title-group.article-title: Incompressible Finite Element Methods for Navier-Stokes Equations with Nonstandard Boundary Conditions in $R^3$

abstract.p: This paper is devoted to the steady state, incompressible Navier-Stokes equations with nonstandard boundary conditions of the form $\mathbf{u} \cdot \mathbf{n = 0}, \mathbf{curl u} \times \mathbf{n = 0}$, either on the entire boundary or mixed with the standard boundary condition $\mathbf {u = 0}$ on part of the boundary. The problem is expressed in terms of vector potential, vorticity and pressure. The vorticity and vector potential are approximated with $\mathbf{curl}$-conforming finite elements and the pressure with standard continuous finite elements. The error estimates yield nearly optimal results for the purely nonstandard problem.
